thread.title: Emma Stone, Dakota Johnson & Meryl Streep take to the red carpet for the 2017 Oscars - Fashion
thread.title_full: Emma Stone, Dakota Johnson & Meryl Streep take to the red carpet for the 2017 Oscars - Fashion

title: Emma Stone, Dakota Johnson & Meryl Streep take to the red carpet for the 2017 Oscars - Fashion
text:
Previous slide Next slide 1 of 38 View All Skip Ad 
The Oscars 2017 is underway, with best actress nominees Ruth Negga, Isabelle Huppert and Emma Stone among the most glamorously dressed awards-goers to grace the red carpet. 
Tonight's ceremony is the culmination of an awards season which began back in December and has seen some major fashion statements, from Nicole Kidman's parrot-shouldered Gucci dress at the SAG awards to Natalie Portman's tribute to Jackie Kennedy at the Golden Globes. 
Despite the very stylish build-up, the Oscars red carpet is unrivalled for big fashion moments. This evening, we're expecting Hollywood's most stylish to serve up a political statements alongside their designer gowns- a trend which has already begun with both Ruth Negga and Karlie Kloss donning blue ribbons in support of the American Civil Liberties Union. 
Meryl Streep arrived wearing an Elie Saab creation following the row which has erupted between her team and Karl Lagerfeld in recent days after the Chanel designer made comments suggesting Streep has decided not to wear Chanel at the last minute because the house refused to pay her. Streep and her stylist Micaela Erlanger have issued statements strongly denying the claims while Lagerfeld and Chanel have also corrected his previous comments. 
Click through the gallery to see what everyone's wearing to the 89th Academy Awards. First up is best actress nominee Emma Stone, who oozes Hollywood allure in Givenchy Haute Couture and Tiffany jewellery. AP
